title: Powertrain Software Engineer (18 Positions)
description: The Powertrain Software engineer is a key position, which develops and tests production Global Powertrain Electronic Control software for various ECM/PCM projects as well as solutions for better Controls & SW development practices for Propulsion systems with greater emphasis on virtualization wherever possible.The successful candidate will join a small and connected team. They will interact with multi-disciplinary Centers of Excellence to analyze, develop and test methods for Powertrain embedded software. The Engineer will work with MATLAB/Simulink, various Configuration Management tools, Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) test equipment, and an internal Calibration database tool and develop, update and maintain process and procedure documents.Basic Qualifications:Graduated in Electrical, Aerospace, Computer Engineering, or other related Engineering degrees.2+ years of experience with Matlab/Simulink software tools.2+ years of experience developing embedded C/C++ code applications.Adherence to a defined software development process.Read, speak and write English fluently. Only English interaction with Global teams.Preferred Qualifications:Skilled in modeling and coding tools such as Matlab, Simulink, and TargetLink.Good knowledge of C/C++ coding, MIL/SIL, HIL, and vehicle testing.Hands-on experience in debugging tools like INCA, Lauterbach.Hands-on experience manual and automated Test case generation.Hands-on experience on static Code Verification and Analysis to verify software standards (e.g. MISRA-C) is achieved.Experience with Build Automation Tools.Experience with scripting languages, for example, M-script, Python.Experience adapting application software into vendor/OEM Software.Experience with Agile methodology.Familiarity with OBD I and II artifacts.Knowledge of Continuous Integration(CI).

title: Marketing Analyst
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Marketing Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica

title: Business Development Analyst
description: We are looking for a Business Development Analyst to join Wildlife's Business Development team in S√£o Paulo, Brazil.In this function, you will be responsible for managing the main partnerships Wildlife already has with other big companies and tackle the best opportunities to guarantee new partnerships that can help us distribute our games to millions of users. You will ensure that we are extracting the most value from the old and new partners to our games.This role suits those who are analytically strong to seize the best opportunities and evaluate the results, and also have very good interpersonal skills to manage both internal and external partners.You will discuss directly with the Game Studio to decide what could be the licensing agreements that would help our old and new games reach the devices of millions of users worldwide and what's the strategy to convince these licensing partners to join our games.We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is curious by nature, is a self-starter (‚Äútakes the initiative‚Äù), loves solving problems, and can thrive in a fast and growing business.What You'll DoBe part of the team that manages the strategic partnerships at WildlifeWork with our current distribution platforms (i.e: App Store or Google Play) to showcase our games and find ways that Wildlife can get advantages to our games through these platforms.Conduct opportunity analysis and make recommendations to the product team on what new distribution platforms Wildlife should be partnered with to launch our games.Mapping licensing opportunities in our current portfolio and future launches.Serve as main contact for some of Wildlife‚Äôs strategic partners.Partner with the product team to check how Wildlife‚Äôs partners can help them leverage our living game games.Partner with the new games teams to decide what is the best way to have our partners helping us with our launch process.Prepare executive communications and reporting on how the partnerships are helping the games and company results.Use internal data to evaluate the results that are coming from different partnerships.Proactively look for problems in processes and propose improvements.What You'll NeedAbility to synthesize complex messages, data sets/signals and insights into executive-ready communicationsAbility to build relationships, manage and influence cross-functional stakeholdersAbility to work independently and manage multiple partnershipsExcellent project management, problem-solving, and analysis skillsAbility to speak and write in English and Portuguese fluentlyMore About YouYou have an analytical frame of mind and fundamentally understand the levers that allow the partnerships to help our games to growYou are hands-on: willing and able to do what's needed in order to learn and find creative and out-of-the-box solutions to scale our gamesYou are ambitious and have a sense of ownership towards our partnerships, and are committed to our games' growthYou want to operate in a high-growth environmentYou are an excellent teammate and raise the bar of those around youAbout WildlifeWildlife is one of the leading mobile game developers and publishers in the world. We have released more than 60 titles, reaching billions of people around the globe. Today, we have offices in Brazil, Argentina, Ireland, and the United States. Here, we create games that will excite, intrigue, and engage our players for years to come!Equal OpportunityWildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.We're committed to providing accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process.

title: Jr Finance Business Partner
description: K√§rcher is the world's leading provider of cleaning solutions with around 13,000 employees in 70 countries and an innovative product offer for commercial and domestic customers alike. Renowned for our innovation, over 80% of our products have been developed in the past 4 years. We owe this success to our employees, their skills, dedication, ideas and commitment. Constant investment in R&D, quality, marketing and design make us a well-known brand and a most attractive employer to develop your career with. Do you want to be part of our growth story?Extraordinary tasks require extraordinary people. As we grow our business we are looking forward to your dedicated support as a Finance Business Partner (m/f/d) for the South America region based in our Brazil‚Äôs facilities at Vinhedo, SP. In this challenging and dynamic role, you will be reporting to our Regional CFO based in Brazil and you will be also reporting to one of our Finance Directors in Germany. In this role, you will be closely partnering with the different subsidiaries in the region to support and monitor critical activities in the finance area.Your tasks:As a Regional Finance Business Partner you consolidate regional reports, prepare comments for the management team, and produce recommendations of improvement.You follow up the subsidiaries detailed rolling forecast and comments on consolidated data. You provide recommendations on the focus topics per subsidiary.Your Qualifications:Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Finance field, i.e. Economics, Business Administration.Consolidated experience as a Finance Sr Analyst / Business Finance Sr Analyst / Finance Business Partner.Good knowledge of general controlling and accounting.Advanced communication skills in Portuguese and English, basic Spanish is a plus.Advanced MS Excel skills.Previous experience working in regional structures is highly desirable.Our Benefits:Health planDental planLife insuranceFlexible timeMore benefits within the facilities to cover food expensesBring back the WOW to your career!

title: Software Engineer, gt.school (Remote) - $80,000/year USD
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of remote full-time jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?Help us to revolutionize the education industry!Research shows that students learn best from individualized, interactive instruction. Yet today, kids sit passively in a classroom being lectured to, with a single teacher often managing 25 children or more. The current education system is not tailored to help children learn effectively. We want to change that.GT School builds the first educational platform for gifted and talented children, driven by cloud services, machine learning and scientific insights. We develop an education metaverse with sophisticated gamification and an adaptive learning environment that engages children from day one and is fun to use. Our goal is to make children score top grades in one-fifth of the classroom time and without the boring exercises.In this role, you will use your advanced coding skills and software design expertise to deliver quality code according to a high-level specification. In a globally remote team of software experts, you will leverage AWS serverless and other cloud technologies to implement a highly scalable and error-free educational platform. Experience in the gaming industry is appreciated. If you‚Äôre looking for a position at the forefront of digital transformation, this is an opportunity for you!What You Will Be DoingImplement Features: Utilize the full power of AWS to implement simple and easy-to-maintain feature updates.Code Review: Reviewing pull requests from your team members to ensure that all code changes comply with our high quality standards.Root Cause Analysis: Solve the toughest bugs by diving deep to find the true root cause and designing a permanent fix.What You Won‚Äôt Be DoingTemporary hacks: We care for the best design to implement lasting changes.Fixing bugs in overtime to catch the release date: With extensive automated testing and qualified code reviews, we deliver every Pull Request straight to production.Software Engineer Key ResponsibilitiesDeliver high-quality code with design level considerations and substantial product impactReview pull requests of your peers to ensure company-wide quality standardsPropose permanent fixes to identified bugs or outages based on a root cause analysisBasic Requirements3+ years of coding experience in Java, Typescript, C#, or C++, including 2+ years of software design for a software service or productAbility to understand and pick up new technologies: We are looking for all-time learners who can dive into any tech stack if necessaryAbility to work 100% remotelyAbout Gt.schoolgt.school is a stealth educational startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. We are building an online community focusing on the most underserved customer base in US education - gifted and talented (GT) kids. We are a remote first company who hires globally via Crossover.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $40 USD/hour, which equates to $80,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next:You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online ‚Äúscreening‚Äù assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.Important! If you do not receive an email from us:First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as ‚ÄúNot Spam‚Äù since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.Crossover Job Code: LJ-4641-BR-PortoAle-SoftwareEngine.002

title: Analyst (Business Intelligence) ‚Äì Supply Strategy and Optimisation (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Supply Optimization and Commercialization (SOCs) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SOCs team works on directly impact Agoda‚Äôs bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including organizational efficiency, sales and product optimization, go to market strategies as well innovation and products. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce highly visible results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SOCs offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.The Opportunity:The SOCs Analytics team is a sub-team within the SOCs team and serve as subject matter experts on analytics, automation, business intelligence, data, and experimentation. We work closely with the other business, product, and analytics teams to develop and build analytical products, systems and automated processes, as well as drive analytical projects to improve organisational performance and drive revenue growth for the company. The analyst will assist in identifying appropriate business metrics for tracking and reporting purposes, as well as build compelling visualisations to guide strategic thinking at all levels of the organisation.In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Use and analyse data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organisationIdentify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organisation leverages on data, insights, and intelligenceDevelop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytical processing (SQL is a must)Experience with visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Grafana, etc.)A basic understanding of statistics, computer science, and data, and the ability to implement this title: Senior Analyst, Partner Communications(Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Associate Manager, Partner Communications:Agoda is looking for a creative, yet analytical team member to join our Partner Communications team and support the ideation, optimization, analysis and execution of our B2B CRM campaigns globally.This role will support the end to end delivery of CRM campaigns/products which support a mixture of wider-company initiatives, ongoing engagement metrics and maintaining/optimizing key products that drive ecommerce revenues. The channels include email, push notifications, SMS, web/in-app messaging and more.The Senior Analyst, Partner Communications will work from the strategic to production level on campaigns to our supply partners, using market-leading technology ‚Äì come up with a great idea and see it come to life all across the globe.Our program is highly sophisticated, data-centric and now is a great time to inject some creative flair into this high visibility channel.Your performance will be measured by the incremental growth your campaigns drive, your ability to create fast learnings and your aptitude to collaborate closely with a high performing team of experts.You will be part of the Marketing team, reporting to the Senior Manager, Partner Communications, based at our regional headquarters in Bangkok.Your responsibilities:Be curious. Look for gaps in our existing portfolio and look for creative new ways to communicate important brand messages ‚Äì drive the creative team to push boundaries; benchmark key competitors, but also strive to be a category leaderTake ownership. Manage campaigns from end to end ‚Äì the daily set-up of one-time and automated mobile campaigns. Work with the marketing team to develop/optimize existing products, manage targeting and segmentation, scheduling and deployment. Own the customer experience and ensure users remain engaged, optimized and activeThink ahead. Manage the roadmap to document and schedule all experiments/campaigns delivered globallyLook for opportunities. Optimize key metrics including CTR, open rates, and salesDesign new products and experiences to address key business needsAct fast. Champion best practices, industry trends, and ensure these are translated into tangible ideas and department frameworksTest, test and test some more. Develop an ongoing and detailed AB testing plan to help the continuous improvement of key metricsYour attributes:You‚Äôre an ideas-person, balancing creative flair, data insights and sound commercial senseYou‚Äôre analytical, great with numbers and can visualize the data to obtain quick buy-in from stakeholdersYou‚Äôve done it before (3+ years of analytical and/or digital experience) and have a proven track record of delivering projects; industry experience an advantageYou‚Äôre technical enough to discuss flows, logic and data with IT geeks, but you don‚Äôt let it overpower your creative edge and customer-focused approachYou can think at scale and deliver translatable ideas that work across languages, cultures and in the digital age, different devicesYour approach:You know your product and market inside-out and constantly evaluate the best-in-class competitors or peers to drive constant self/function improvementYou‚Äôre used to taking action and you simplify your tasks to achieve your goalsYou believe that learning is everything ‚Äì to you, testing is the best way to learnYou constantly think about scalability, whilst understanding and accommodating segment nuances for optimal resultsYou can collaborate and motivate different stakeholders towards a single goal, some of whom may work in different functions/departments and have different KPIsExcellent verbal and written communication. You can adapt your style for multi-cultural and cross-functional audiences, simplifying and adapting your message appropriatelyYour qualifications & experience:A minimum of a Bsc./equivalent in mathematics, marketing, communication, business, or other related field. An MBA/Masters‚Äô degree an advantageAt least 3 year‚Äôs relevant work experience in an analytical or data-driven marketing fieldStrong analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use data to develop and measure marketing campaigns. You must be very comfortable using data to make recommendations and drive decisionsSound knowledge of digital marketing best practices, measures and metricsAdvanced knowledge of Excel ‚Äì VLOOKUP and Pivot Tables should be second-natureStrong communication skills and attention to detailSolid project management skillsTeam management experience, including people development and KPI settingExperience title: Business Develop Analyst
description: Position SummaryBusiness development analyst (BDA) will support BDM activities in most tactical analysis, reports and business updates. It is also expected a new range of sales activities such as analyzing new business opportunities and relationship with bottler‚Äôs teams, supporting TDMs and Regional Managers as well. The BDA will be responsible for business analytics for the region, compiling and ensuring accuracy, consistency and congruency for the information. The BDA will also be responsible for maintaining Scorecards (bottler ranking) within respective territory as well as the development and preparation of presentations for the Sales Management Team for both internal and external use.Essential Job FunctionsProvide analysis and interpretation of internal/external international market data, Detailed analyses of each Monster and competitive SKU‚Äôs and channels, especially tactical analysis, daily and monthly reportsSupport on developing new system implementationCommunication with bottlersOrganizing dataDevelop dashboards and relevant materials to support sales teams including regional managers and TDMsOrganizing supervisorBottlers relationship with sales teams (sales supervisors)Research new business opportunities (new product results, coverage opportunities by channel and bottler, customer with cooler placement results, c-stores results report, and Key Account Scorecard preparation)Support sales and coverage results from assigned bottlersCollaborate with the Sales Management to meet sales objectives to expand company revenue and profitCoolers information tracking and availability analysisVPO tracking and detailed analysisDetailed analyses of Nielsen and other 3rd party data for trends, insights, etc.Establish and cultivate relationships with local and regional customersComplete supplier reports, including distribution and volume for company totals on a monthly basis.Complete all internal control records, forms, and reports accurately.Prepare special reports for management as requested.Assist in ensuring that all work tasks are performed by staff in a safe and secure manner.Perform other duties as assignedPosition RequirementsExceptional analytical skills.Strong verbal and written communications skills and presentation skills.Strong math, time management, and customer service skills.Demonstrated appreciation for the value of attention to detail and accuracy in completing tasks.Self-motivated, committed and entrepreneurial. Furthermore, you have a proactive sales style and a ‚Äúcan do mentality‚ÄùResults-driven and committed to creating new business opportunitiesTeam oriented.Self-starter.Strong computer skills familiarity with Excel, Word, Power Point, and Outlook.Bachelor‚Äôs degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in business, management, or a related field preferred. Equivalent related experience may be substituted for educational requirements.Fluent in English

title: Marketing Analyst
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Marketing Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica

title: Senior Fraud Prevention Analyst
description: EBANX is a global fintech company that emerged in 2012 with the mission of connecting companies to Latin America, facilitating payments on international sites such as Aliexpress, Airbnb, Sony, Spotify, and many others. As we grew, our portfolio also expanded and we went beyond payment methods. Today we offer solutions in local processing for Brazilian companies and different products and services for our final consumers.From the beginning of our journey, we have an important mission: to give access. And this is not just about our products and services, but it goes through everything we are and do. We believe that it is possible to give access without distinction of race, color, religion, gender identity, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, ancestry or age. Plurality is what makes our Big Dream possible.We are called ebankers and we are changing the way people buy, connect, and live globally. Do you want to join our Big Dream and be part of this team?This person will work directly in the Fraud Prevention Relationship and cross work with Fraud Prevention Performance and Chargeback Management. The main responsibility will manage the relationship with partners and internal teams to build the connection between Fraud Prevention team, internal areas, and our partners to improve our operation, quality service and KPIs, aligned with EBANX strategy.This person will also be responsible to manage projects that involve fraud prevention targets. We are looking for a determined and resilient person who is simple and manage to simplify our processes in a practical way, helping us to make data driven decisions.Requirements and qualifications:Full Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computing, Systems, Engineering, or Business Science.Knowledge in Digital Payments, Fraud Prevention Process, Card Scheme Monitoring Program.Advanced negotiation and presentation skillsExperience managing reporting/data teamsAbility to work on cross-functional projects and experience with Scrum, Agile, Lean or Design Thinking.Ability to use data to identify opportunities to improve process and business strategyExperience with Process Mapping/Modeling.Skill in Microsoft Office and Google Office.Advanced English.Intermediary SQL: Write, review and join queries across multiple databases, use parameters, create variables and extract data.Experience with Data Storytelling: Data Visualization, analysis frameworks, problem summarization, use cases.Responsibilities and assignments:Monitor performance indicators (KPI) to identify and report in detail any instabilities, anomalies, deviations, risks, or opportunities.Lead strategic projects to fraud prevention teamManage the relationship with acquirers, issuers, brands for our main partners in Latam.Map processes to identify risks and opportunities for improvement in operational efficiency.Participate in EBANX Squads to collaborate and specify the development of solutions and systems with the technology and data teams.Specify, create, control and report on financial losses, recovery, and operating costs.Provide support and assistance, sometimes immediately, to the area's Managers team, contributing as possible through solutions and executions of diverse or urgent demands.What else would we like to see?Python is a plus.Spanish would be a differential.Certified in Project Management is a plus.Enthusiastic, proactive, team player and problem solverEBANX offers:A challenging environment, with opportunities to growth;Casual office and dress code;Spanish, English and Portuguese classes;WAVES - Program of goals and results (variable compensation);EBANX Play - Wellness (Gympass, e-Sports, SESC );Semi flexible hours (8 hours a day - Monday to Friday);Meal Allowance;Transportation voucher (if needed);EBANX Education: scholarship;EBANX Skills: budget for workshops and courses;Hello ebanker: psychology, finance and legal orientation.Health and Dental Insurance;Blue Club: Exclusive discount for ebankers in bakeries, restaurants, courses, electronics store and more!Follow us on Instagram and look for the hashtag #ebanxlife to learn more about EBANX's culture.

title: Senior Analyst, Partner Communications(Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Associate Manager, Partner Communications:Agoda is looking for a creative, yet analytical team member to join our Partner Communications team and support the ideation, optimization, analysis and execution of our B2B CRM campaigns globally.This role will support the end to end delivery of CRM campaigns/products which support a mixture of wider-company initiatives, ongoing engagement metrics and maintaining/optimizing key products that drive ecommerce revenues. The channels include email, push notifications, SMS, web/in-app messaging and more.The Senior Analyst, Partner Communications will work from the strategic to production level on campaigns to our supply partners, using market-leading technology ‚Äì come up with a great idea and see it come to life all across the globe.Our program is highly sophisticated, data-centric and now is a great time to inject some creative flair into this high visibility channel.Your performance will be measured by the incremental growth your campaigns drive, your ability to create fast learnings and your aptitude to collaborate closely with a high performing team of experts.You will be part of the Marketing team, reporting to the Senior Manager, Partner Communications, based at our regional headquarters in Bangkok.Your responsibilities:Be curious. Look for gaps in our existing portfolio and look for creative new ways to communicate important brand messages ‚Äì drive the creative team to push boundaries; benchmark key competitors, but also strive to be a category leaderTake ownership. Manage campaigns from end to end ‚Äì the daily set-up of one-time and automated mobile campaigns. Work with the marketing team to develop/optimize existing products, manage targeting and segmentation, scheduling and deployment. Own the customer experience and ensure users remain engaged, optimized and activeThink ahead. Manage the roadmap to document and schedule all experiments/campaigns delivered globallyLook for opportunities. Optimize key metrics including CTR, open rates, and salesDesign new products and experiences to address key business needsAct fast. Champion best practices, industry trends, and ensure these are translated into tangible ideas and department frameworksTest, test and test some more. Develop an ongoing and detailed AB testing plan to help the continuous improvement of key metricsYour attributes:You‚Äôre an ideas-person, balancing creative flair, data insights and sound commercial senseYou‚Äôre analytical, great with numbers and can visualize the data to obtain quick buy-in from stakeholdersYou‚Äôve done it before (3+ years of analytical and/or digital experience) and have a proven track record of delivering projects; industry experience an advantageYou‚Äôre technical enough to discuss flows, logic and data with IT geeks, but you don‚Äôt let it overpower your creative edge and customer-focused approachYou can think at scale and deliver translatable ideas that work across languages, cultures and in the digital age, different devicesYour approach:You know your product and market inside-out and constantly evaluate the best-in-class competitors or peers to drive constant self/function improvementYou‚Äôre used to taking action and you simplify your tasks to achieve your goalsYou believe that learning is everything ‚Äì to you, testing is the best way to learnYou constantly think about scalability, whilst understanding and accommodating segment nuances for optimal resultsYou can collaborate and motivate different stakeholders towards a single goal, some of whom may work in different functions/departments and have different KPIsExcellent verbal and written communication. You can adapt your style for multi-cultural and cross-functional audiences, simplifying and adapting your message appropriatelyYour qualifications & experience:A minimum of a Bsc./equivalent in mathematics, marketing, communication, business, or other related field. An MBA/Masters‚Äô degree an advantageAt least 3 year‚Äôs relevant work experience in an analytical or data-driven marketing fieldStrong analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use data to develop and measure marketing campaigns. You must be very comfortable using data to make recommendations and drive decisionsSound knowledge of digital marketing best practices, measures and metricsAdvanced knowledge of Excel ‚Äì VLOOKUP and Pivot Tables should be second-natureStrong communication skills and attention to detailSolid project management skillsTeam management experience, including people development and KPI settingExperience title: Marketing Analyst
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Marketing Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica

title: Analyst (Business Intelligence) ‚Äì Supply Strategy and Optimisation (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Supply Optimization and Commercialization (SOCs) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SOCs team works on directly impact Agoda‚Äôs bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including organizational efficiency, sales and product optimization, go to market strategies as well innovation and products. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce highly visible results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SOCs offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.The Opportunity:The SOCs Analytics team is a sub-team within the SOCs team and serve as subject matter experts on analytics, automation, business intelligence, data, and experimentation. We work closely with the other business, product, and analytics teams to develop and build analytical products, systems and automated processes, as well as drive analytical projects to improve organisational performance and drive revenue growth for the company. The analyst will assist in identifying appropriate business metrics for tracking and reporting purposes, as well as build compelling visualisations to guide strategic thinking at all levels of the organisation.In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Use and analyse data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organisationIdentify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organisation leverages on data, insights, and intelligenceDevelop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting themDrive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organisational efficiencyWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A hacker‚Äôs mindset ‚Äì the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototypingBachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative disciplineExperience in big data cleaning and wrangling as well as simple analytical processing (SQL is a must)Experience with visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Grafana, etc.)A basic understanding of statistics, computer science, and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situationsIt‚Äôs Great if you have:Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/SparkExperience with ETLs in Hadoop title: Software Development Engineer
description: 21762 Software Development Engineer (Open)Position Type:Full timeLocation(s):BR.Londrina.RemoteBR.Londrina.OfficePosition Details:CSG is a leader in innovative customer engagement, revenue management, and payments solutions that make ordinary customer experiences extraordinary.As a flexible first organization, you can find our remote and on-site locations here.CSG is hiring a Software Dev Engineer to join our team Digital Wholesale Solutions Development team. This person will join a squad that builds and maintains applications to the Digital Wholesale Telecom market.As a software development Engineer at CSG, you will have the opportunity to work with different teams across the globe.You will help us to solve customers problems in the Telecom industry working with several experts that not only know the technical side but the business as well.You will work within an Agile team to develop new applications in a highly iterative fashion, and you will be working in close collaboration with product owners, system analysts, and test engineers.Develop microservers that integrate CSG‚Äôs Digital wholesale product using NodeJs, Kafka, Oracle, Angular, and other technologies.You may resolve technical issues/error messages encountered by customers in a live production environment.You will perform your work under minimal supervision on significate assignments.Qualifications:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a technically related field or equivalent experience.2+ years of experience in software development and software support/maintenance.Ability to develop algorithms, to develop code, to unit test, to debug code, and to document.Knowledge of OOP/OOD concepts.Hands-on experience with at least one of these technologies: NodeJS, Java, Python, or PL/SQL.English verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills.Works well within a team environment and Agile methods.Preferrable:Desirable knowledge on using Docker containers.Following NodeJS frameworks is desirable: NestJS, TyperORMKubernetes knowledge is a plus.NestJs framework knowledge is a plus.Kafka and event driver microservices architecture is a plus.

title: Marketing Analyst
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Marketing Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica

title: Analyst (Business Intelligence) ‚Äì Supply Strategy and Optimisation (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Supply Optimization and Commercialization (SOCs) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SOCs team works on directly impact Agoda‚Äôs bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including organizational efficiency, sales and product optimization, go to market strategies as well innovation and products. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce highly visible results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SOCs offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.The Opportunity:The SOCs Analytics team is a sub-team within the SOCs team and serve as subject matter experts on analytics, automation, business intelligence, data, and experimentation. We work closely with the other business, product, and analytics teams to develop and build analytical products, systems and automated processes, as well as drive analytical projects to improve organisational performance and drive revenue growth for the company. The analyst will assist in identifying appropriate business metrics for tracking and reporting purposes, as well as build compelling visualisations to guide strategic thinking at all levels of the organisation.In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Use and analyse data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organisationIdentify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organisation leverages on data, insights, and intelligenceDevelop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting themDrive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organisational efficiencyWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A hacker‚Äôs mindset ‚Äì the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototypingBachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative disciplineExperience in big data cleaning and wrangling as well as simple analytical processing (SQL is a must)Experience with visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Grafana, etc.)A basic understanding of statistics, computer science, and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situationsIt‚Äôs Great if you have:Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/SparkExperience with ETLs in Hadoop title: Senior Analyst, Partner Communications(Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Associate Manager, Partner Communications:Agoda is looking for a creative, yet analytical team member to join our Partner Communications team and support the ideation, optimization, analysis and execution of our B2B CRM campaigns globally.This role will support the end to end delivery of CRM campaigns/products which support a mixture of wider-company initiatives, ongoing engagement metrics and maintaining/optimizing key products that drive ecommerce revenues. The channels include email, push notifications, SMS, web/in-app messaging and more.The Senior Analyst, Partner Communications will work from the strategic to production level on campaigns to our supply partners, using market-leading technology ‚Äì come up with a great idea and see it come to life all across the globe.Our program is highly sophisticated, data-centric and now is a great time to inject some creative flair into this high visibility channel.Your performance will be measured by the incremental growth your campaigns drive, your ability to create fast learnings and your aptitude to collaborate closely with a high performing team of experts.You will be part of the Marketing team, reporting to the Senior Manager, Partner Communications, based at our regional headquarters in Bangkok.Your responsibilities:Be curious. Look for gaps in our existing portfolio and look for creative new ways to communicate important brand messages ‚Äì drive the creative team to push boundaries; benchmark key competitors, but also strive to be a category leaderTake ownership. Manage campaigns from end to end ‚Äì the daily set-up of one-time and automated mobile campaigns. Work with the marketing team to develop/optimize existing products, manage targeting and segmentation, scheduling and deployment. Own the customer experience and ensure users remain engaged, optimized and activeThink ahead. Manage the roadmap to document and schedule all experiments/campaigns delivered globallyLook for opportunities. Optimize key metrics including CTR, open rates, and salesDesign new products and experiences to address key business needsAct fast. Champion best practices, industry trends, and ensure these are translated into tangible ideas and department frameworksTest, test and test some more. title: Senior Analyst, Partner Communications(Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Associate Manager, Partner Communications:Agoda is looking for a creative, yet analytical team member to join our Partner Communications team and support the ideation, optimization, analysis and execution of our B2B CRM campaigns globally.This role will support the end to end delivery of CRM campaigns/products which support a mixture of wider-company initiatives, ongoing engagement metrics and maintaining/optimizing key products that drive ecommerce revenues. The channels include email, push notifications, SMS, web/in-app messaging and more.The Senior Analyst, Partner Communications will work from the strategic to production level on campaigns to our supply partners, using market-leading technology ‚Äì come up with a great idea and see it come to life all across the globe.Our program is highly sophisticated, data-centric and now is a great time to inject some creative flair into this high visibility channel.Your performance will be measured by the incremental growth your campaigns drive, your ability to create fast learnings and your aptitude to collaborate closely with a high performing team of experts.You will be part of the Marketing team, reporting to the Senior Manager, Partner Communications, based at our regional headquarters in Bangkok.Your responsibilities:Be curious. Look for gaps in our existing portfolio and look for creative new ways to communicate important brand messages ‚Äì drive the creative team to push boundaries; benchmark key competitors, but also strive to be a category leaderTake ownership. Manage campaigns from end to end ‚Äì the daily set-up of one-time and automated mobile campaigns. Work with the marketing team to develop/optimize existing products, manage targeting and segmentation, scheduling and deployment. Own the customer experience and ensure users remain engaged, optimized and activeThink ahead. Manage the roadmap to document and schedule all experiments/campaigns delivered globallyLook for opportunities. Optimize key metrics including CTR, open rates, and salesDesign new products and experiences to address key business needsAct fast. Champion best practices, industry trends, and ensure these are translated into tangible ideas and department frameworksTest, test and test some more. title: Analyst (Business Intelligence) ‚Äì Supply Strategy and Optimisation (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Supply Optimization and Commercialization (SOCs) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SOCs team works on directly impact Agoda‚Äôs bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including organizational efficiency, sales and product optimization, go to market strategies as well innovation and products. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce highly visible results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SOCs offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.The Opportunity:The SOCs Analytics team is a sub-team within the SOCs team and serve as subject matter experts on analytics, automation, business intelligence, data, and experimentation. We work closely with the other business, product, and analytics teams to develop and build analytical products, systems and automated processes, as well as drive analytical projects to improve organisational performance and drive revenue growth for the company. The analyst will assist in identifying appropriate business metrics for tracking and reporting purposes, as well as build compelling visualisations to guide strategic thinking at all levels of the organisation.In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Use and analyse data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organisationIdentify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organisation leverages on data, insights, and intelligenceDevelop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting themDrive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organisational efficiencyWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A hacker‚Äôs mindset ‚Äì the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototypingBachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative disciplineExperience in big data cleaning and wrangling as well as simple analytical processing (SQL is a must)Experience with visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Grafana, etc.)A basic understanding of statistics, computer science, and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situationsIt‚Äôs Great if you have:Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/SparkExperience with ETLs in Hadoop
