title: Senior Analyst, Partner Communications(Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Associate Manager, Partner Communications:Agoda is looking for a creative, yet analytical team member to join our Partner Communications team and support the ideation, optimization, analysis and execution of our B2B CRM campaigns globally.This role will support the end to end delivery of CRM campaigns/products which support a mixture of wider-company initiatives, ongoing engagement metrics and maintaining/optimizing key products that drive ecommerce revenues. The channels include email, push notifications, SMS, web/in-app messaging and more.The Senior Analyst, Partner Communications will work from the strategic to production level on campaigns to our supply partners, using market-leading technology ‚Äì come up with a great idea and see it come to life all across the globe.Our program is highly sophisticated, data-centric and now is a great time to inject some creative flair into this high visibility channel.Your performance will be measured by the incremental growth your campaigns drive, your ability to create fast learnings and your aptitude to collaborate closely with a high performing team of experts.You will be part of the Marketing team, reporting to the Senior Manager, Partner Communications, based at our regional headquarters in Bangkok.Your responsibilities:Be curious. Look for gaps in our existing portfolio and look for creative new ways to communicate important brand messages ‚Äì drive the creative team to push boundaries; benchmark key competitors, but also strive to be a category leaderTake ownership. Manage campaigns from end to end ‚Äì the daily set-up of one-time and automated mobile campaigns. Work with the marketing team to develop/optimize existing products, manage targeting and segmentation, scheduling and deployment. Own the customer experience and ensure users remain engaged, optimized and activeThink ahead. Manage the roadmap to document and schedule all experiments/campaigns delivered globallyLook for opportunities. Optimize key metrics including CTR, open rates, and salesDesign new products and experiences to address key business needsAct fast. Champion best practices, industry trends, and ensure these are translated into tangible ideas and department frameworksTest, test and test some more. Develop an ongoing and detailed AB testing plan to help the continuous improvement of key metricsYour attributes:You‚Äôre an ideas-person, balancing creative flair, data insights and sound commercial senseYou‚Äôre analytical, great with numbers and can visualize the data to obtain quick buy-in from stakeholdersYou‚Äôve done it before (3+ years of analytical and/or digital experience) and have a proven track record of delivering projects; industry experience an advantageYou‚Äôre technical enough to discuss flows, logic and data with IT geeks, but you don‚Äôt let it overpower your creative edge and customer-focused approachYou can think at scale and deliver translatable ideas that work across languages, cultures and in the digital age, different devicesYour approach:You know your product and market inside-out and constantly evaluate the best-in-class competitors or peers to drive constant self/function improvementYou‚Äôre used to taking action and you simplify your tasks to achieve your goalsYou believe that learning is everything ‚Äì to you, testing is the best way to learnYou constantly think about scalability, whilst understanding and accommodating segment nuances for optimal resultsYou can collaborate and motivate different stakeholders towards a single goal, some of whom may work in different functions/departments and have different KPIsExcellent verbal and written communication. You can adapt your style for multi-cultural and cross-functional audiences, simplifying and adapting your message appropriatelyYour qualifications & experience:A minimum of a Bsc./equivalent in mathematics, marketing, communication, business, or other related field. An MBA/Masters‚Äô degree an advantageAt least 3 year‚Äôs relevant work experience in an analytical or data-driven marketing fieldStrong analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use data to develop and measure marketing campaigns. You must be very comfortable using data to make recommendations and drive decisionsSound knowledge of digital marketing best practices, measures and metricsAdvanced knowledge of Excel ‚Äì VLOOKUP and Pivot Tables should be second-natureStrong communication skills and attention to detailSolid project management skillsTeam management experience, including people development and KPI settingExperience title: Marketing Analyst
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Marketing Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica

title: Senior Project Analyst
description: EBANX is a global fin-tech company that emerged in 2012 with the mission of connecting companies to Latin America, facilitating payments on internacional sites such as Aliexpress, Airbnb, Sony, Spotify, and many others. As we grew, our portfolio also expanded and we went beyond payment methods. Today we offer solutions in local processing for Brazilian companies and different products and services for our final consumers.We are called ebankers and we are changing the way people buy, connect, and live globally. Do you want to join our Big Dream and be part of this team?We are searching for a Senior Project Analyst that will support a large scale project involving several areas from the organization.As a Senior Project Analyst, you will be responsible for:Support business and technology projects managing scope, schedule, cost, time and quality from inception through to completion;Coordinate cross-project activities managing both dependencies and interfaces between different areas (Finance, Product, Legal, Compliance, etc);Ensure the delivery is to the appropriate level of quality and on time, in accordance with the plan;Coordinate and manage project reporting and regularly communicate it to key stakeholders.Main requirements for this position:Successful track record of leading and/or participating in projects in complex and cross-functional environments;High level of tech-related project management experience;Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;Knowledge in both waterfall and agile project management frameworks, tools, processes and techniques;Advanced English (we will test it);Analytical skills and attention to details, using data in the decision-making process;Self-manageable profile.What else would we like to see?Knowledge in the payments industry (background in acquirers, payment gateways, card network schemes, etc), would be a huge differential;Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc);Intermediate Spanish.EBANX offers:A challenging environment, with opportunities to growth;Casual office and dress code;Spanish, English and Portuguese classes;WAVES - Program of goals and results (variable compensation);EBANX Play - Wellness (Gympass, e-Sports, SESC );Semi flexible hours (8 hours a day - Monday to Friday);Meal Allowance;Transportation voucher (if needed);EBANX Education: scholarship;EBANX Skills: budget for workshops and courses;Hello ebanker: psychology, finance and legal orientation.Health and Dental Insurance;Blue Club: Exclusive discount for ebankers in bakeries, restaurants, courses, electronics store and more!Follow us on Instagram and look for the hashtag #ebanxlife to learn more about EBANX's culture.

title: Quality Analyst I
description: Digital technology has forever changed business. Now, it‚Äôs transforming tax. As governments go digital, financial systems and traditional tax software can't keep up. And, businesses now face escalating risk and mounting compliance costs. Sovos was built for the digital future of tax, with complete, connected offerings for tax determination, continuous transaction control compliance, tax reporting and more. The company supports more than 8,000 customers, including half of the Fortune 500, operating in over 70 countries. Its SaaS products and proprietary Sovos S1 Platform integrate with a wide variety of business applications and government compliance processes.Our employees throughout North America, Latin America and Europe are building the future of global compliance software. We want you to build your future with us.We are looking for passionate Sr. Quality Analyst to join our team!The Work You‚Äôll DoAs a Sr. Quality Analyst, you will ensure the quality of products, tools, and services developed by Sovos. The person in this role will understand the problems and proposed solutions as well as estimate the effort to test stories. Communication and teamwork are important in their day to day as well as the ability of provide support to other team members when needed.More Specifically, You WillAnalyze and understand any software modules being modified and design a test planPerform impact analysisWrite test casesCreate, use and maintain regression test suites/plansCreate test scenariosExecute test cases (manual and automated)Able to combine useful exploratory/ad-hoc testing with pre-defined tests planAble to identify what should be automatedCreate and maintain automated testsParticipation in team meetingsUnderstanding of release process and how it affects their team.What We Need From YouAdvanced English skills (written and verbal)At least four years working in a QA role; two of those with automated testsSound grasp of agile methodologyKnowledge of relational databasesKnowledge regarding JAVA and PhythonHigh level of proficiency with the following:Databases (SQL, Postgres SQL), perform test, stress test, and loading test.Continuous integrationPython, Ruby or another LanguageJira and ZephyrWhat Does Sovos Offer You?The tools to grow your career both personally and professionally:That Can Happen Because Growth Is Serious Business Here At Sovos, And We Have The Programs In Place To Make Sure Of It, IncludingDid you know that over 30% of our employees earned a promotion or job change In FY2020.Mentoring ProgramsManagement Bootcamps and Development TrainingsYearly performance reviews where compensation and performance are assessed and rewarded generouslyClear paths for growth within our roles (but we know that career development can be like a spider web, not a ladder - we give you the tools to move outside of your career as well!)Are you worried that you don‚Äôt check all of the boxes? Apply anyway! There are no perfect candidates - we hire people, not resumes. We are excited that you‚Äôre here and we look forward to taking a look at your application to establish next steps.Sovos is an equal opportunity employer and those seeking employment with us are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Growth Senior Analyst
description: Muni is an e-commerce platform that aims to revolutionize the e-commerce space in Latin America by leveraging our clients' community relationships to sell all kinds of products, with free next-day delivery and an absolute commitment to quality and confidence.To continue growing we need a Senior Analyst to be part of the Acquisition & Onboarding team within the Growth area. Brazil will be your focus, but our team is Global so you will have exposure to our multiple geographies.As an Acquisition & Onboarding Senior Analyst at Muni you will produce a massive impact on a hyper-growth startup, working hand-in-hand with a top-notch team.To be part of our team you must have at least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst, Growth Analyst or similar experience.ResponsibilitiesLead the execution and implementation of new acquisition and onboarding strategies (e.g., incentives, communications)Measure the results of your actions implementing A/B testsDefine KPIs and implement dashboard to monitor the effectiveness of your executionsCoordinate with Branding team the design of arts and pieces required for your communication strategiesDesign and implement customer communication journeys leveraging messaging software (e.g., Twilio, Treble.ai)Extract the information required to launch your incentives from our Databases using SQLDefine specific strategies to drive conversion rate in Brazil through Onboarding strategiesGive guidance to the rest of the team regarding language and cultural aspects when launching initiatives in BrazilRequirements2 years experience as Business Analyst, Growth Analyst or similar jobRobust data driven approach to problem solvingWell developed communication skillsAdvanced Excel or Google Sheets capabilitiesBasic knowledge of SQL (Advanced knowledge will be a valued)Experience with customer journeys, user communication flows and user messaging softwareFluency in Portuguese, and proficiency in English or Spanish (or both)Experience in startup is not required but desirable

title: Senior Analyst, Partner Communications(Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Associate Manager, Partner Communications:Agoda is looking for a creative, yet analytical team member to join our Partner Communications team and support the ideation, optimization, analysis and execution of our B2B CRM campaigns globally.This role will support the end to end delivery of CRM campaigns/products which support a mixture of wider-company initiatives, ongoing engagement metrics and maintaining/optimizing key products that drive ecommerce revenues. The channels include email, push notifications, SMS, web/in-app messaging and more.The Senior Analyst, Partner Communications will work from the strategic to production level on campaigns to our supply partners, using market-leading technology ‚Äì come up with a great idea and see it come to life all across the globe.Our program is highly sophisticated, data-centric and now is a great time to inject some creative flair into this high visibility channel.Your performance will be measured by the incremental growth your campaigns drive, your ability to create fast learnings and your aptitude to collaborate closely with a high performing team of experts.You will be part of the Marketing team, reporting to the Senior Manager, Partner Communications, based at our regional headquarters in Bangkok.Your responsibilities:Be curious. Look for gaps in our existing portfolio and look for creative new ways to communicate important brand messages ‚Äì drive the creative team to push boundaries; benchmark key competitors, but also strive to be a category leaderTake ownership. Manage campaigns from end to end ‚Äì the daily set-up of one-time and automated mobile campaigns. Work with the marketing team to develop/optimize existing products, manage targeting and segmentation, scheduling and deployment. Own the customer experience and ensure users remain engaged, optimized and activeThink ahead. Manage the roadmap to document and schedule all experiments/campaigns delivered globallyLook for opportunities. Optimize key metrics including CTR, open rates, and salesDesign new products and experiences to address key business needsAct fast. title: Analyst/ Senior Analyst- Customer Marketing (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.The Opportunity:The Customer Marketing Team is looking for a Analyst/ Senior Analyst who is ready to help us take our Channels performance to the next level.As an Analyst/ Sr.Analyst, CRM you will be working with all kind of customer, traffic and engagement data to deliver insights that will shape the Strategy of our team and to help us collect and understand Agoda‚Äôs Customer‚Äôs needs, desires and behaviour.Some typical questions that we are trying to answer are:What do customers care about the most, and what drives them to action? How can we best address it?How do we define that a Customer is Engaged? And what‚Äôs the correlation between Engagement and LifetimeValue?What kind of behaviour are predictive of the value of a customer? Can we get more customers to show it, and how?Is there a right sequence of information to deliver? What is the best channel for each customer and campaign? And how often can/should we get in touch? What should the message look like?In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Analyze: new ideas come from data and tests. Segment the userbase, understand their patterns, react to change in demand and identify new opportunities to deliver valueTest: prove your findings by A/B testing changes to any of our communication products. Define your hypothesis, design the framework, launch the campaign, collect and analyze the results of large scale, quick delivery testsInnovate: Learn and develop new features, develop models we can use for optimization, build business cases for completely new implementations, and help us push the boundaries a little further every dayThis role is good for you if you:Are naturally curious, with a focus on value: deliver all kind of insights, prioritizing by impactValue independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not so much tasksHave the ambition to make a difference: innovation and drive are necessary to succeedAre ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledgeWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A proactive, self-driven, exploratory approach to dataAt least 2 years of experience in analytically focused positionsGood Hadoop/SQL and Tableau knowledgeGood knowledge of statistics and data processing practices (calculating p-values, data cleaning and normalization, regressions, etc.)It‚Äôs Great if you Have:Experience with Customer Marketing/Customer Behaviour dataWorking knowledge of Python or RMaster‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative or marketing subject (statistics, engineering, digital marketing, financial modelling, etc.)#STRA#ANLS#MRKT#3 #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego title: Marketing Analyst
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Marketing Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica

title: Marketing Analyst
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Marketing Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica

We are looking for you!

title: Analyst (Business Intelligence) ‚Äì Supply Strategy and Optimisation (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Supply Optimization and Commercialization (SOCs) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SOCs team works on directly impact Agoda‚Äôs bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including organizational efficiency, sales and product optimization, go to market strategies as well innovation and products. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce highly visible results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SOCs offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.The Opportunity:The SOCs Analytics team is a sub-team within the SOCs team and serve as subject matter experts on analytics, automation, business intelligence, data, and experimentation. We work closely with the other business, product, and analytics teams to develop and build analytical products, systems and automated processes, as well as drive analytical projects to improve organisational performance and drive revenue growth for the company. The analyst will assist in identifying appropriate business metrics for tracking and reporting purposes, as well as build compelling visualisations to guide strategic thinking at all levels of the organisation.In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Use and analyse data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organisationIdentify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organisation leverages on data, insights, and intelligenceDevelop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting themDrive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organisational efficiencyWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A hacker‚Äôs mindset ‚Äì the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototypingBachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative disciplineExperience in big data cleaning and wrangling as well as simple analytical processing (SQL is a must)Experience with visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Grafana, etc.)A basic understanding of statistics, computer science, and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situationsIt‚Äôs Great if you have:Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/SparkExperience with ETLs in Hadoop How can we best address it?How do we define that a Customer is Engaged? And what‚Äôs the correlation between Engagement and LifetimeValue?What kind of behaviour are predictive of the value of a customer? Can we get more customers to show it, and how?Is there a right sequence of information to deliver? What is the best channel for each customer and campaign? And how often can/should we get in touch? innovation and drive are necessary to succeedAre ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledgeWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A proactive, self-driven, exploratory approach to dataAt least 2 years of experience in analytically focused positionsGood Hadoop/SQL and Tableau knowledgeGood knowledge of statistics and data processing practices (calculating p-values, data cleaning and normalization, regressions, etc.)It‚Äôs Great if you Have:Experience with Customer Marketing/Customer Behaviour dataWorking knowledge of Python or RMaster‚Äôs Degree or title: Digital Sales Analyst
description: Company OverviewWarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world‚Äôs best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.Join us. Shape your story here.The JobKey FunctionsUnder Manager guidance, support the execution of the strategies for Digital Partners Distribution of WarnerMedia Portfolio, based in the company‚Äôs business plan and revenue objectives.The DailySupport manager in the HBO Max integration and development process for new digital partners deals.Account management support: oversee clients daily support such as: contract management, integration issues, subs monthly base, monthly invoice, etc.Accounts to support: Primepass, Playhub, Campsoft, LinQNet, PointNetworAcquisition: liaise with Affiliates MKT team to secure the HBOMAX growth. Support manager in the development of promotional offers and acquisition programs to each key account: Playhub, Primepass, Campsoft.Business Development: support Manager with the Digital Business expansion, contacting new prospects and advising new opportunities on digital environment for the WM portfolio. Key goalsClose new HBOMAX dealsCreate control of prospects and first contactJoin events/forums seeking for business learnings and new opportunities.Attitude-Be pro-active and energetic. A hands-on person and follow-up on jobs.Supportive-Be a team worker, support other colleagues, departments, partners/third parties and customers with their requirements.Responsibility, organization and execute all projects and tasks. Creativity, bring new ideas, visit customers according to demand.The EssentialsUniversity degree in Business Administration, Economy or Marketing related fieldsExperience in Sales (preferable in consumer company), Marketing or related areas.Fluent in English (writing, speaking and reading)Knowledge in data management (thru Excel and Power Point): dealing with data bases and complex spreadsheetsDigital environment friendlyStrong relationship capabilitiesDesirable account support experienceThe PerksExclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screeningsPaid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employeesAccess to well-being tools, resources, and freebiesAccess to in-house learning and development resourcesPart of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brandsWarner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

title: Senior Cost Control Analyst
description: Description Du PostePrepare for review the asset internal budget (Group Budget) and subsequent closure forecasts; the cost controller shall gather the technical inputs/ figures and consolidates with running costs allocated to the asset.Prepare for review the JV budget and its revisions based on Group budget and subsequent forecasts.Issue monthly reports of Capex and Opex actuals vs. budget and latest forecast.Respond to any further need of actuals‚Äô explanations and comparisons from the HQ expressed by Budget & Reporting team.Respond to any query related to actuals from JV partners expressed by JV Accounting team.Revise information/ figures for closure works (provisions of technical costs and time sheeting/ cost allocation cycles for running cost)Identify any cost trends and challenge the technician‚Äôs estimates and the affiliate time-writing.Support issuance of all necessary asset, subsidiary and partners cost information (ex.: AFE ‚Äì Authorization for Expenditure submitted to partners).Attend to JV meetings, such as FCM, and provide any support (documentation, presentation, explanation)Organize internal monthly meetings with the JV Accountant, JV Coordinator and JV Planning and Development Engineer. 11. Support internal and partners regular audits.Maintain a system of storage and retrieval of asset budget and cost documents.Maintain the asset WBS (Work Breakdown Structure) Masterdata on SAP.Input the monthly oil production on SAP and update the oil stock with gain/losses provided by Commercial/ OBO Direction.Ensure the offloading costs monitoring and active participate on P2P (Purchase to Pay) process for Commercial department (approve Purchase Requisitions, issue Purchase Orders, process goods receipt, attend to Procurement meetings with internal contractors, Supply Chain and suppliers).Perform SOX (Sarbanes-Oxley) controls related to operated assets.Provide professional advice and guidance to all entities within Operated Assets Direction with respect to cost and financial matters.Contexte et EnvironnementCost control of Operated Assets switched to Finance Direction responsibility on 2019. On 2020 the new cost controller may still face lack of information traceability. The two big challenges will be the first partner‚Äôs audit and the development of South-West area of Lapa field. Concerning methods and tools, SAP migration to the new Unisol version represents a change management project in parallel to intense regular activities.Profil recherch√©University degree in accounting, economy, administration or engineering;Experience in Oil & Gas industry;Used to work in a challenge environment and with sharp deadlines;Fluent in English; 5 years‚Äô experience or more desirableR√©f√®rence47415BRM√©tierCost Control & ReportingR√©gion, d√©partement, localit√©BrazilLocalisation (Pr√©cisions/Mots-cl√©s)DowntownType d‚ÄôemploiFixed term positionNiveau d‚Äôexp√©rience requisMinimum 3 years, Minimum 6 yearsSoci√©t√© EmployeurTotalEnergies EP Brasil Ltda.BrancheExploration and Production

title: Analyst/ Senior Analyst- Customer Marketing (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.The Opportunity:The Customer Marketing Team is looking for a Analyst/ Senior Analyst who is ready to help us take our Channels performance to the next level.As an Analyst/ Sr.Analyst, CRM you will be working with all kind of customer, traffic and engagement data to deliver insights that will shape the Strategy of our team and to help us collect and understand Agoda‚Äôs Customer‚Äôs needs, desires and behaviour.Some typical questions that we are trying to answer are:What do customers care about the most, and what drives them to action? How can we best address it?How do we define that a Customer is Engaged? And what‚Äôs the correlation between Engagement and LifetimeValue?What kind of behaviour are predictive of the value of a customer? Can we get more customers to show it, and how?Is there a right sequence of information to deliver? What is the best channel for each customer and campaign? And how often can/should we get in touch? What should the message look like?In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Analyze: new ideas come from data and tests. Segment the userbase, understand their patterns, react to change in demand and identify new opportunities to deliver valueTest: prove your findings by A/B testing changes to any of our communication products. Define your hypothesis, design the framework, launch the campaign, collect and analyze the results of large scale, quick delivery testsInnovate: Learn and develop new features, develop models we can use for optimization, build business cases for completely new implementations, and help us push the boundaries a little further every dayThis role is good for you if you:Are naturally curious, with a focus on value: deliver all kind of insights, prioritizing by impactValue independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not so much tasksHave the ambition to make a difference: innovation and drive are necessary to succeedAre ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledgeWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A proactive, self-driven, exploratory approach to dataAt least 2 years of experience in analytically focused positionsGood Hadoop/SQL and Tableau knowledgeGood knowledge of statistics and data processing practices (calculating p-values, data cleaning and normalization, regressions, etc.)It‚Äôs Great if you Have:Experience with Customer Marketing/Customer Behaviour dataWorking knowledge of Python or RMaster‚Äôs Degree or title: Business Operation Analyst PL
description: EBANX is a global fintech company that emerged in 2012 with the mission of connecting companies to Latin America, facilitating payments on internacional sites such as Aliexpress, Shopee, Sony, Spotify, and many others. As we grew, our portfolio also expanded and we went beyond payment methods. Today we offer solutions in local processing for Brazilian companies and different products and services for our final consumers. We are called ebankers and we are changing the way people buy, connect, and live globally. Do you want to join our Big Dream and be part of this team?We are seeking a Business Operation Analyst PL to be part of a high growth technology and payments company with a solid track record of delivering high value to our customers. By joining us you will have the opportunity to be a part of our growing Corporate Initiatives Team.The ebanker will work with the Business Operations Team focused on Strategics Merchants, you will find many opportunities to engage with different business areas (technology teams, fraud prevention, commercial and merchant services) and improve the overall performance of payment solutions offered by EBANX.As a Full Business Operation Analyst you will be responsible for:Daily analysis of monitoring alerts, focusing on immediate action in case of reduction of approval rate;Proactive performance with commercial teams, engineering and fraud prevention;Constant monitoring of all pillars of approval rates with a focus on MERCHANT: approval of acquirers, issuers, BINs, products and divisions: CVV, Card Verify Pre Auth and others;Constant evaluation of merchants' checkouts, focusing on identifying UX improvements that result in increased approval rates;Analyze the impact of business rules on merchants results with a focus on implementing improvements;Conduct periodic schedules with merchants, with a focus on presenting key results, improvement opportunities and action plans;Monitoring of approval rates on a daily/Weekly/Monthly basis;Producing Insights based on past performance;Improve future performance by coming up with strategies;Ensure all merchant KPIs met through these strategies.Main requirements for this position:Outstanding data driven mindset and problem-solving skills;Experience in a fast-paced, data-driven environment;Good communication skills, both verbal and written;Organized and proactive mind;Experience in presenting and conducting meetings;Excellent Microsoft Powerpoint and Excel skills;Proficiency in English (advanced or fluent).What else would we like to see?Experience in Payments Market, E-commerce or Similars;SQL & BI knowledge;Storytelling skills;Desire to see the big picture;Spanish is a differential.EBANX offers:A challenging environment, with opportunities to growth;Casual office and dress code;Spanish, English and Portuguese classes;WAVES - Program of goals and results (variable compensation);EBANX Play - Wellness (Gympass, e-Sports, SESC );Semi flexible hours (8 hours a day - Monday to Friday);Meal Allowance;Transportation voucher (if needed);EBANX Education: scholarship;EBANX Skills: budget for workshops and courses;Hello ebanker: psychology, finance and legal orientation.Health and Dental Insurance;Blue Club: Exclusive discount for ebankers in bakeries, restaurants, courses, electronics store and more!Follow us on Instagram and look for the hashtag #ebanxlife to learn more about EBANX's culture.

title: Business Analyst - Marketing Analytics
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Business Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica #natechcities

title: Analyst/ Senior Analyst- Customer Marketing (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.The Opportunity:The Customer Marketing Team is looking for a Analyst/ Senior Analyst who is ready to help us take our Channels performance to the next level.As an Analyst/ Sr.Analyst, CRM you will be working with all kind of customer, traffic and engagement data to deliver insights that will shape the Strategy of our team and to help us collect and understand Agoda‚Äôs Customer‚Äôs needs, desires and behaviour.Some typical questions that we are trying to answer are:What do customers care about the most, and what drives them to action? How can we best address it?How do we define that a Customer is Engaged? And what‚Äôs the correlation between Engagement and LifetimeValue?What kind of behaviour are predictive of the value of a customer? Can we get more customers to show it, and how?Is there a right sequence of information to deliver? What is the best channel for each customer and campaign? And how often can/should we get in touch? What should the message look like?In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Analyze: new ideas come from data and tests. Segment the userbase, understand their patterns, react to change in demand and identify new opportunities to deliver valueTest: prove your findings by A/B testing changes to any of our communication products. Define your hypothesis, design the framework, launch the campaign, collect and analyze the results of large scale, quick delivery testsInnovate: Learn and develop new features, develop models we can use for optimization, build business cases for completely new implementations, and help us push the boundaries a little further every dayThis role is good for you if you:Are naturally curious, with a focus on value: deliver all kind of insights, prioritizing by impactValue independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not so much tasksHave the ambition to make a difference: innovation and drive are necessary to succeedAre ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledgeWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A proactive, self-driven, exploratory approach to dataAt least 2 years of experience in analytically focused positionsGood Hadoop/SQL and Tableau knowledgeGood knowledge of statistics and data processing practices (calculating p-values, data cleaning and normalization, regressions, etc.)It‚Äôs Great if you Have:Experience with Customer Marketing/Customer Behaviour dataWorking knowledge of Python or RMaster‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative or marketing subject (statistics, engineering, digital marketing, financial modelling, etc.)#STRA#ANLS#MRKT#3 #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego title: Business Analyst - Marketing Analytics
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Business Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica #natechcities

title: Business Analyst - Marketing Analytics
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Business Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica #natechcities

title: Analyst/ Senior Analyst- Customer Marketing (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.The Opportunity:The Customer Marketing Team is looking for a Analyst/ Senior Analyst who is ready to help us take our Channels performance to the next level.As an Analyst/ Sr.Analyst, CRM you will be working with all kind of customer, traffic and engagement data to deliver insights that will shape the Strategy of our team and to help us collect and understand Agoda‚Äôs Customer‚Äôs needs, desires and behaviour.Some typical questions that we are trying to answer are:What do customers care about the most, and what drives them to action? How can we best address it?How do we define that a Customer is Engaged? And what‚Äôs the correlation between Engagement and LifetimeValue?What kind of behaviour are predictive of the value of a customer? Can we get more customers to show it, and how?Is there a right sequence of information to deliver? What is the best channel for each customer and campaign? And how often can/should we get in touch? What should the message look like?In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Analyze: new ideas come from data and tests. Segment the userbase, understand their patterns, react to change in demand and identify new opportunities to deliver valueTest: prove your findings by A/B testing changes to any of our communication products. Define your hypothesis, design the framework, launch the campaign, collect and analyze the results of large scale, quick delivery testsInnovate: Learn and develop new features, develop models we can use for optimization, build business cases for completely new implementations, and help us push the boundaries a little further every dayThis role is good for you if you:Are naturally curious, with a focus on value: deliver all kind of insights, prioritizing by impactValue independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not so much tasksHave the ambition to make a difference: innovation and drive are necessary to succeedAre ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledgeWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A proactive, self-driven, exploratory approach to dataAt least 2 years of experience in analytically focused positionsGood Hadoop/SQL and Tableau knowledgeGood knowledge of statistics and data processing practices (calculating p-values, data cleaning and normalization, regressions, etc.)It‚Äôs Great if you Have:Experience with Customer Marketing/Customer Behaviour dataWorking knowledge of Python or RMaster‚Äôs Degree or
