title: Analyst, Business Operations
description: Established in Melbourne in 2015, Airwallex is a global payments fintech business transforming the way businesses move and manage money globally. We have built a global financial infrastructure platform to help businesses transact, collect and pay across 130+ countries and 50+ currencies, without the constraints of the traditional global financial system.Airwallex is Australia‚Äôs fastest growing fintech unicorn. We've grown to 13 global locations and have raised over $800 million in funding. Airwallex has been recognised in Forbes' Cloud 100 2020, and placed in the Top 50 of KPMG‚Äôs Global Fintech100 two years in a row. To support our ambitious growth plans, we‚Äôre looking for smart, collaborative and passionate people who are looking to make a genuine impact.Airwallex is looking for a Platform Business Operations Analyst who can use their analytical skills to shape our sales strategy and business operations. You will be responsible for implementing and managing global sales processes, collateral, tools, and systems to optimise the effectiveness of our sales team.As an early member of the Platform Strategy & Business Operations team, you‚Äôll wear many hats and directly contribute to the direction of Airwallex's Platform strategy. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to work closely with our strategy, marketing, and sales team to contribute to high-impact initiatives including analysing our pricing models, assessing and implementing sales process improvements, creating sales collateral and enablement materials, and more! This role is a unique and exciting opportunity to be part of an evolving team during hyper-growth.Who You AreYou‚Äôre a problem solver ‚Äì you love to solve problems, are a critical thinker and have a demonstrated history of working with and understanding complex systemsYou‚Äôre a great communicator ‚Äì you‚Äôre able to articulate complex concepts in a simple wayYou‚Äôre a multi-tasker ‚Äì you‚Äôre able to prioritise your time and tasks effectively, have the ability to pick up new systems quickly and have a keen eye for detailYou‚Äôre a great team player ‚Äì you‚Äôll be working with people across diverse global offices and will need to work collaboratively with them to solve problemsYou think big - you will have the ability to influence and optimise the financial operations support processes and systems as we grow and scale the teamWhat You'll DoAnalyse pricing models, including understanding our costs and competitor pricingAssess and implement sales process improvementsCreate external sales collateral and internal sales enablement contentCollaborate with regional strategy leads and sales teams to understand market insights and product requirementsSupport everyday business operations: forecasting, reporting, ad hoc analysis, etc.What You'll BringExceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, apply logical reasoning, perform quantitative analysis, and develop and implement solutionsSelf-starter mentality with a high degree of motivation to understand root causes and deliver successful plansA ‚Äúdo what it takes‚Äù attitude to own and execute high quality outcomesHigh attention to detail in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentAbility to adjust on the fly to new demands; sense of urgency and prioritisationAdvanced Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets modeling capabilitiesStrong verbal and written communication skillsTrack record of collaborating across teamsStart-up & fintech experience a plusSalesforce experience a plusSQL and Looker experience a plusExperience in banking, corporate strategy, sales operations, management consulting, product marketing, sales enablement, finance a plusTertiary education (Bachelor‚Äôs degree or other in either commerce, Econ, Management, Engineering or similar)At Airwallex you‚Äôll have the ability to make an impact in a rapidly growing, global fintech. You‚Äôll be offered a competitive salary and we also like to ensure we create the best environment for our people by providing a collaborative open office space with a fully stocked kitchen. We organise regular team building events, encourage flexible/remote working and we give our people the freedom to be creative.Airwallex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and anyone seeking employment at Airwallex is considered based on merit, qualifications, competence and talent. We don‚Äôt regard colour, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, sex, marital or family status, disability, gender, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: Business Analyst - Marketing Analytics
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Business Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica #natechcities

title: Business Analyst Health and Benefits
description: The Role:As a Health and Benefits Business analyst your primary objective is helping businesses implement Benefits Marketplace solution in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners.Key responsibilities include:Eliciting requirementsPlanning and monitoring the requirement elicitation processRequirements organizationTranslating and simplifying requirementsRequirements management and communicationRequirements analysisReview and design the test cases, process change request and manage project‚Äôs scope, acceptance, installation and deployment.The Requirements:Strong knowledge in health, home, and funeral, life and personal insurances is desirable.Aptitude and experience to:*Implement advanced strategies for gathering, reviewing and analyzing data requirements*Prioritize requirements and create conceptual prototypes and mock-ups*Process modeling, traceability and quality management techniques*Apply best practices for effective communication and problem-solvingStrong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skillsEnglish speaking, writing and reading requiredStrong Microsoft Office skills and Process Design tools.Bachelor‚Äôs degree required, preferably in a program with heavy emphasis on process management as: Business Administration, Industrial Engineering or computer science, Etc.+ 3 year of experience is requiredEqual Opportunity Employer

title: Senior Strategy & Operations Sales Analyst -LatAm
description: Reporting to the Director of Sales Operations, the LatAm Senior Analyst of Sales Operations will be responsible for working with Sales leadership in the region to drive key objectives for the business and turning data driven insights into actions. This newly created role will work cross functionally with Sales, Finance and other Go-To-Market teams. This will be the first sales strategy & operations hire in the LatAm region. The right candidate must have the ability to both think strategically to develop plans, and also have the operational expertise to execute on them.What Your Day Could Consist OfPartner with regional Sales leadership to define and execute sales strategy, policies, processes and business system requirementsOwn forecasting and planning process for LatAm, as well as global consolidation.Determine territories, quota and headcount for each region.Provide visibility into the health of the business and timely performance tracking through dashboards and business reviewsPerform analysis to identify gaps and maximize Sales productivity and efficiencyDrive operational efficiency and productivity with continuous tools and process improvements.What Is Needed3-5+ years in sales or revenue operations; must have SaaS experienceAdvanced skills in MS Excel; Comfort with BI tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.), SQL knowledge preferred. Strong data/query assessment abilities.Strong analytical thinker with an outcomes-oriented approach to sales and sales operations. Experience with managing key metrics for sales success.Comfortable working in a fast paced environment and dealing with ambiguity. Flexible and open to changing priorities, and managing multiple tasks simultaneously within compressed timeframes.Effective communication skills, verbal and written. Ability to communicate the right level of information to executives and cross-functional teams at the right cadence.Highly organized self-starter who enjoys driving business impact and operational efficiency.Strong business acumen, troubleshooting, problem-solving, and project management skills.Collaborative team player who is effective partnering cross functionally.About ActiveCampaignWe are a category-defining Customer Experience Automation Platform (CXA) that helps over 150,000 businesses in 170 countries meaningfully engage with their customers. The platform gives businesses of all sizes access to 600+ pre-built automations that combine email marketing, marketing automation, CRM, and machine learning for powerful segmentation and personalization across social, email, messaging, chat, and text.As a global multicultural company, we are proud of our inclusive culture which embraces diverse voices, backgrounds, and perspectives. We don‚Äôt just celebrate our differences, we believe our diversity is what empowers our innovation and success. You can find out more about our DEI initiatives here .As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in the world, we are scaling rapidly to keep up with market demand. We are growing all of our teams and looking for people who share our values, deliver innovation frequently, and join us in our mission to grow our customer base from 150,000 today to millions. We have been ranked #4 Best Place to Work on Built In Chicago in 2021, a best workplace for remote employees by Quartz and received recognition as a great place to work across all of our regions, and continue to be globally recognized for our employee-centric culture here .Perks And BenefitsActiveCampaign is an employee-first culture. We take care of our employees at work and outside of work. You can see more of the details here , but some of our most popular benefits include:Comprehensive health and wellness benefits (including no premiums for employees on our HSA plan, telehealth and tele-mental health, and access to the Calm app for mediation)Open paid time offGenerous 401(k) matching with no vestingGenerous stipend to outfit your remote officeCareer growth including access to personal and professional coaching. We take a proactive approach to diversity and inclusion and offer parental leave, career pathing, and support employees‚Äô ongoing learning and development through Udemy and access to life coaches via Modern HealthCool swagActiveCampaign is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, hire, pay, grow and promote no matter of gender, race, color, sexual orientation, religion, age, protected veteran status, physical and mental abilities, or any other identities protected by law.Our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) strive to foster a diverse inclusive environment by supporting each other, building a strong sense of belonging, and creating opportunities for mentorship and professional growth for their members.

title: Analyst/ Senior Analyst- Customer Marketing (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.The Opportunity:The Customer Marketing Team is looking for a Analyst/ Senior Analyst who is ready to help us take our Channels performance to the next level.As an Analyst/ Sr.Analyst, CRM you will be working with all kind of customer, traffic and engagement data to deliver insights that will shape the Strategy of our team and to help us collect and understand Agoda‚Äôs Customer‚Äôs needs, desires and behaviour.Some typical questions that we are trying to answer are:What do customers care about the most, and what drives them to action? How can we best address it?How do we define that a Customer is Engaged? And what‚Äôs the correlation between Engagement and LifetimeValue?What kind of behaviour are predictive of the value of a customer? Can we get more customers to show it, and how?Is there a right sequence of information to deliver? What is the best channel for each customer and campaign? And how often can/should we get in touch? What should the message look like?In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Analyze: new ideas come from data and tests. Segment the userbase, understand their patterns, react to change in demand and identify new opportunities to deliver valueTest: prove your findings by A/B testing changes to any of our communication products. Define your hypothesis, design the framework, launch the campaign, collect and analyze the results of large scale, quick delivery testsInnovate: Learn and develop new features, develop models we can use for optimization, build business cases for completely new implementations, and help us push the boundaries a little further every dayThis role is good for you if you:Are naturally curious, with a focus on value: deliver all kind of insights, prioritizing by impactValue independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not so much tasksHave the ambition to make a difference: innovation and drive are necessary to succeedAre ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledgeWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A proactive, self-driven, exploratory approach to dataAt least 2 years of experience in analytically focused positionsGood Hadoop/SQL and Tableau knowledgeGood knowledge of statistics and data processing practices (calculating p-values, data cleaning and normalization, regressions, etc.)It‚Äôs Great if you Have:Experience with Customer Marketing/Customer Behaviour dataWorking knowledge of Python or RMaster‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative or marketing subject (statistics, engineering, digital marketing, financial modelling, etc.)#STRA#ANLS#MRKT#3 #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego title: LAR Customer and Partner Marketing Senior Analyst
description: Overview:Worldline is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry and #4 player worldwide. With its global reach and its dedication to innovation, Worldline is the technology partner of choice for merchants, banks and third-party acquirers as well as public transport operators, government agencies and industrial companies in all sectors. Powered by over 20,000 employees in more than 50 countries, Worldline provides its clients with balanced, trusted and secure solutions across the payment value chain, encouraging their business growth wherever they are. Ingenico is Worldline¬¥s commercial brand related to payment terminals, services and solutions.Objective/purpose:The LAR Customer and Partner Marketing Senior Analyst has an essential contribution to LAR Marketing Team. The focus is on implementing integrated marketing plans for defined players, accelerating strategic goals achievements by building and implementing marketing campaigns.The successful candidate will be data-driven with a proven track record of driving growth through online and offline marketing programs. Should be able to think/act with a bottom-line orientation, develop structured plans and be willing to implement hands-on. This person will need to be able to prioritize and deliver on deadlines with minimal direction and have the ability to persuade and influence others.ResponsibilitiesImplement Partner Portal content strategy, coordinating with other departments to guarantee excellent executionPlan, implement and measure marketing campaigns bringing insightful retro feeding information to guarantee continuous improvementCreate and adapt sales enablement segmented materials considering our customer and partners characteristics, needs, and Ingenico strategyMaintain customers and partners intelligence databaseWork with agencies to develop campaigns, from briefing to results trackMarketing planning, vendors management, and budgetingSkills required:University Degree in Marketing, Communication, Business Administration, or related fieldsOver five years of professional experience in marketing/communicationsStrong knowledge of B2B marketing in the technology industryExperience in managing complex, multi-stakeholder projects and achieving goals on time and to budget.High attention to detail and the capacity to prioritize competing demands; excellent time management and organizational skills is a requirementExperience creating written content in Portuguese and EnglishLanguages:Fluency in English and PortugueseSpanish advancedSoft skillsDemonstrable ability to drive forward work on own initiativeRespectful style to drive collaboration in a multi-stakeholder environmentDemonstrable ability to motivate and enthuse othersInnovative and proactive personalityCollaborative attitude, willingness to share and give your experience, and positive can-do attitude with the team and organizationWell-organized with a customer focused approach

title: Analyst/ Senior Analyst- Customer Marketing (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.The Opportunity:The Customer Marketing Team is looking for a Analyst/ Senior Analyst who is ready to help us take our Channels performance to the next level.As an Analyst/ Sr.Analyst, CRM you will be working with all kind of customer, traffic and engagement data to deliver insights that will shape the Strategy of our team and to help us collect and understand Agoda‚Äôs Customer‚Äôs needs, desires and behaviour.Some typical questions that we are trying to answer are:What do customers care about the most, and what drives them to action? How can we best address it?How do we define that a Customer is Engaged? And what‚Äôs the correlation between Engagement and LifetimeValue?What kind of behaviour are predictive of the value of a customer? Can we get more customers to show it, and how?Is there a right sequence of information to deliver? What is the best channel for each customer and campaign? And how often can/should we get in touch? What should the message look like?In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Analyze: new ideas come from data and tests. Segment the userbase, understand their patterns, react to change in demand and identify new opportunities to deliver valueTest: prove your findings by A/B testing changes to any of our communication products. Define your hypothesis, design the framework, launch the campaign, collect and analyze the results of large scale, quick delivery testsInnovate: Learn and develop new features, develop models we can use for optimization, build business cases for completely new implementations, and help us push the boundaries a little further every dayThis role is good for you if you:Are naturally curious, with a focus on value: deliver all kind of insights, prioritizing by impactValue independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not so much tasksHave the ambition to make a difference: innovation and drive are necessary to succeedAre ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledgeWhat you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:A proactive, self-driven, exploratory approach to dataAt least 2 years of experience in analytically focused positionsGood Hadoop/SQL and Tableau knowledgeGood knowledge of statistics and data processing practices (calculating p-values, data cleaning and normalization, regressions, etc.)It‚Äôs Great if you Have:Experience with Customer Marketing/Customer Behaviour dataWorking knowledge of Python or RMaster‚Äôs Degree or title: Business Analyst - Marketing Analytics
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Business Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica #natechcities

description: Experience including financial equity research or consulting.|English and Portuguese fluentAbout Our ClientCRISIL is a global, agile and innovative analytics company driven by its mission of making markets function better. We are India's foremost provider of ratings, data, research, analytics, and solutions. A strong track record of growth, a culture of innovation and global footprint sets us apart. We are majority-owned by S&P Global Inc., a leading provider of transparent and independent ratings, benchmarks, analytics and data to the capital and commodity markets worldwide.Job DescriptionBuildandmaintaindetailed financial models for publiclytradedcompanies in theLatAmmarketsPrepare/update equity models including DCF valuation, peer analysis, relative value analysis and key operating and financial metricsAnalyze industry macro trends and company financials under the direction of the Senior analyst based in LondonPrepare writtenresearchreportsvarying in scope andsizefromquickearningsbriefs to thematicreportson a range oftopics for largeinstitutionalclientsReview business and trade publications, annual reports, financial filings and other sources in order to gather, synthesize and interpret data on companies followed by the Senior analyst.Candidates need to possess a strong sense of intellectual curiosity, unwavering attention to detail and adaptability to work in a dynamic work environment.The Successful ApplicantExperience including financial equity research or consulting required.Strong business modeling experience, financial statement analysis and working with large data sets required (3+ years)English and Portuguese language capabilities are requiredExceptionalanalytical, organizational, writtenand verbal communicationskillsHighlevelofattention to detailandaccuracyUnderstanding of LatAm. & global financial markets and TMT industry dynamics preferredWillingness to stretch and work with global clientsSuccessful candidates will have a strong work ethic, ability to meet strict deadlines and work as part of an integrated teamExcellentExcel & databasemanagementskillsrequiredWhat's On OfferContract by Page InterimContact: Nina FrancaQuote job ref: 194415Brand: PP

title: Senior Analyst, Brasil Country Finance

role for you.Apply today to find out more about this position. Please submit your CV in English.

title: Business Analyst-BR-Sao Paulo-Sao Paulo
description: We are a digitally native technology services company where innovation, design and engineering meet scale. We use some of the latest technologies in the digital and cognitive field to empower organizations in every aspect.Right now, we are looking for Business Analysts to join our Product Acceleration Studio. title: Business Analyst
description: We are looking for a Business Analyst to join Wildlife's User Acquisition team in S√£o Paulo, Brazil.That Means We Have ToIn this function, you will be responsible for managing our digital marketing campaigns, which impact millions of users daily. You will ensure that they have the lowest cost possible, while maximising the number of downloads they generate. This role suits those who are analytically strong and want to make a direct impact on our business growth by bringing new users to our games. There are millions of mobile games available worldwide - our role is to make sure that all potential users end up playing our games, efficiently.‚Äì Understand users‚Äô behaviors and predict how valuable they are for our games.‚Äì Impact these users on the most cost-efficient way across all placements available.We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is curious by nature, is a self-starter ("takes the initiative"), loves solving problems, and can thrive in a fast and growing business.What You'll DoBe responsible for the return on investment of hundreds of campaigns, optimizing them in order to increase our number of downloads in multiple gamesPropose targeting segmentations and explore opportunities to optimize campaigns across multiple gamesDevelop strategies, test plans, measure performance, and execute scenarios analysisEvaluate our spend's efficiency in view of its results, and provide insights about itEstablish relationships with different partners inside and outside the company, to ensure growth efficiency and maximum reach of several gamesWhat You'll NeedBachelor's degree in Engineering, Statistics, Economics or related experience;Broad knowledge of statistics;Basic programming skills, preferably R and SQL;Strong analytical skills: you understand how to analyze metrics and data and proposes appropriate action based on that;Strong organizational skills: you can execute autonomously several tasks based on priorities agreed with the team and manager;Strong communication skills: advanced writing and speaking in English, and ability to synthesize analysis into insights;Comfortable working in a fast-paced and highly dynamic environment.More About YouYou have an analytical frame of mind and fundamentally understand the levers that allow marketing campaigns to scaleYou are hands-on: willing and able to do what's needed in order to learn and find creative and out-of-the-box solutions to scale our gamesYou are ambitious and have a sense of ownership towards campaigns in your channel, and are committed to our games' growthYou want to operate in a high-growth environmentYou are an excellent teammate and raise the bar of those around youAbout WildlifeWildlife is one of the leading mobile game developers and publishers in the world. We have released more than 60 titles, reaching billions of people around the globe. Today, we have offices in Brazil, Argentina, Ireland, and the United States. Here, we create games that will excite, intrigue, and engage our players for years to come!Equal OpportunityWildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.We're committed to providing accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process.

title: Business Analyst - Marketing Analytics
description: About ToptalToptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world‚Äôs largest fully remote company.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAre you looking to play a meaningful role as a strategic advisor to both our business functions and our leaders? Do you have an uncanny ability to see the bigger picture and make cross-functional connections to business processes, performance, and data? If so, we encourage you to apply to our Business Analyst role! This role reports to the Director of Business Analytics and is on the Business Operations team. Our Business Operations Team is a multi-disciplinary group working across the broader Toptal organization to orchestrate the strategic approach, execution frameworks, analytics, and team structures necessary to drive Toptal‚Äôs growth.We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level analyst to support our Marketing team, by providing our business leaders with crucial insights and recommendations for improvement. This team member will use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop reports. They will also build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform in-depth diagnostic analysis.We are very driven and proactive, think independently, and do not just take orders. This person needs to build positive relationships across the organization and have a ‚Äúfind a way‚Äù attitude. Ultimate success goes beyond data- and modeling-related activities and delivers the ‚Äúso what‚Äù that drives decisions and real business impact. The expectation is to answer not only the question asked but the one that wasn‚Äôt!This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.ResponsibilitiesPartner with our Marketing team to empower data-backed decision making.Analyze data, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, build financial models, and extract insights from all these activities to inform business decisions.Build models utilizing SQL and Python.Utilize your analysis skills to assess and make recommendations that will optimize the performance of the organization.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and that are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency, conversion, revenue generation, client and talent experience, operations, communication, systems & tools, etc.In The First Week, Expect ToOnboard and integrate into Toptal, and quickly begin learning about Toptal‚Äôs history, culture, and vision.Shadow key teams to learn the core of Toptal‚Äôs operations and capabilities.Start to familiarize yourself with all existing data sources.In The First Month, Expect ToObtain a basic understanding of the Marketing function and its operations.Understand the data generated through company operations and activities and where/how that data is stored.Assess the current state of performance metrics, reports, dashboards, models, and analyses used, and identify discrepancies and areas for improvement.Begin supporting the function leaders with relevant insights and reports for bi-weekly leadership meetings.In The First Three Months, Expect ToDevelop a proficiency of data elements and obtain a robust understanding of critical business processes.Gain an understanding and ability to assess the drivers and impacts of business decisions on performance.Begin standardizing definitions and aligning metrics with OKRs and company initiatives.Begin identifying new opportunities to explore in the quest to improve performance continually.In The First Six Months, Expect ToBegin to solve real business problems as a team that will move the needle on key performance metrics and financial performance.Help us align and standardize metric definitions across the company.Perform detailed root cause analysis to expose critical drivers of performance.In The First Year, Expect ToInform significant strategic initiatives, goals, priorities, and performance indicators.Become an expert both on business process and data flow, and assist in building a new outstanding business analytics function.Requirements3+ years of experience in business analytics, data science, business intelligence, or reporting is required.Experience supporting or working with a Marketing team is strongly preferred.Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, UltiProBI, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency in SQL; experience with R, Python, or MATLAB is a plus.Experience with Google Analytics is preferred.Experience in exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics, experience with process improvement is a plus.Ability to explain complex issues simply and intuitively, and willingness to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots.Both a proven background in math, science, finance, engineering, or statistics and deep business insight and financial sense are required; advanced degrees and/or MBA are a plus.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.For Toptal Use Only: #canada #southamerica #natechcities

title: Senior Finance Analyst
description: Job DescriptionAbout the role:If you believe that a business process can always be improved, we need to talk!The largest brewery in the world has a vacancy open for Senior Finance Analyst at the Global team.Responsible for managing the P&L, ZBB and CAPEX results for Global BEES, building insighful analysis, dashboards and PBI used by BEES VP's to build the area strategy.Make the correct alignments within the PPM Office in GBX Campinas, BEES Office in New York as well as alignments with the zones for the monthly routines. title: Senior Operational Risk Analyst
description: About NubankNubank was founded in 2013 to free people from a bureaucratic, slow and inefficient financial system. Since then, through innovative technology and outstanding customer service, the company has been redefining people's relationship with money across Latin America. With operations in Brazil, Mexico and Colombia, Nubank is today the largest digital banking platform in the world outside of Asia and one of the leading technology companies in the world, reinventing over 40 million customers' financial lives.Nubank achieved this by offering a no-fee credit card, entirely managed by a mobile app, and a digital account, free of taxes. Nubank also offers transparent and hassle-free personal loans, a business account tailored for SMBs, and life insurance. In 2020, Nubank acquired digital broker Easynvest, now called Nu invest, and became the leader in self-directed digital investments in Brazil.Throughout the years, Nubank raised around US$2 billion with some of the best-known growth and technology investors in the world, such as Berkshire Hathaway, Sequoia, DST, Tencent, Tiger, Kaszek, Founders Fund, Dragoneer, TCV, Redpoint, Ribbit, GIC, Whale Rock, Invesco, QED, and Capital Group.Today, Nubank is a global company, with offices in S√£o Paulo (Brazil), Mexico City (Mexico), Buenos Aires (Argentina), Bogot√° (Colombia), Durham (United States) and Berlin (Germany). It was founded in 2013 in Sao Paulo, by Colombian David V√©lez, and cofounded by Brazilian Cristina Junqueira and American Edward Wible. For more information, visit www.nubank.com.br.About The TeamOur mission as a team is to maintain and constantly improve the operational risk management process in order to ensure a sustainable growth for Nubank. With that in mind, we analyze current risks and identify potential ones that may affect our journey.About The RoleUnderstand the main international frameworks and methodologies about Operational Risks and Internal Controls so that together we can build the best methodologies in the risk management environment (ISO 31000, COSO, COBIT, COSO ERM);Understand the differences from old risk management to modern risk management, focusing more on data and risk appetite, rather than processes and documents (Traditional Banks x Fintechs);Understand Regulatory Capital (Basel or ORSA), as well as Loss Database and be willing to build the processes around the subject;Deep knowledge and experience in presentations to senior management and governance forums, for the assembly and consolidation of risk information in an executive manner;Knowledge of tools and systems for risk management (GRC Tools, like: SAP MIC, Service Now, Bwise, Bravo);Experience in Tests of internal controls in all areas of the institution considering operational risks;What We Are Looking ForExperience working with processes mapping, internal controls and operational risk management;Experience in presentations for Committees and Governance Forums;Knowledge in Methodologies about Operational Risks and Internal Controls;Has good understanding of the English language;Has good understanding about SQL.Role LocationS√£o Paulo, Brazil.Interviewing and onboarding is currently done virtually due to COVID-19. Everyone new to the team and our current staff will remain working from home until it is safe to return to our offices. If/when relocation is required, we have a team dedicated to global mobility and have partnered up with the best companies in the market to make sure processes run smoothly. We also offer a very competitive relocation package for international hires.Diversity & InclusionAt Nubank, we want to be sure that we're building a more diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the customers we serve and seek to empower. That's why we hire based on equality. We consider gender, ethnicity, race, religion, sexual orientation, and other identity markers as enriching elements to our company while ensuring neither of them represent a barrier when recruiting fantastic talent.

description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful testsDisplay: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and othersModeling: Analyze the vast amounts of private equity, or strategy/business operations for a fast-growing globally operating tech companyExposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQLGood title: Business Analyst III
description: Digital technology has forever changed business. Now, it‚Äôs transforming tax. Soon, tax enforcement will be part of every business process - and every transaction. As governments go digital, financial systems and traditional tax software can't keep up. And, businesses now face escalating risk and mounting compliance costs. Sovos was built for the digital future of tax. The Sovos Intelligent Compliance Cloud Is the first complete solution for modern tax, combining tax determination, e-Invoicing compliance and tax reporting on Sovos' reliable, scalable and secure S1 Platform.We are building the future of Global Compliance Software. We want you to build your future with us.The Work You Will DoThe Business Analysts facilitates the ‚Äòmaking sense‚Äô of a problem domain by enabling teams to articulate information, explore items under discussion and converge towards a clear and common outcome.The BA Role at Sovos within the VAT Line of Business, execute impact analysis and product assessment, as regular task, to determine and communicate the impact of fiscal regulations into our global compliance solutions.More Specifically, You WillDeeply understand the solutions Sovos offers, global business flows and needs. Understand how tax regulations impact our products and generate user stories to comply with those legal mandates.Performs Product Discovery, Impact analysis and support to the implementation.Support products in use by diagnosing and resolving issues and also participate in initiatives to improve processes, standards and practices.Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects, Software Engineers, QA, and other technical staff to ensure our internal and external systems are operating properly.Support PMs and POs in the prioritization and roadmaps elaboration.BA Provides:To the Development, clarity over the business needs adding details that help the Development Team to facilitate their understanding.To the Business, clarity over the development feedback to facilitate their understanding so they can evaluate and plan based on solid and accurate estimation in terms of time and functionalities.To the Stakeholders, an assessment that allows different stakeholders to evaluate and plan the next steps in terms of business and market decisionWhat We Need From YouIT backgroundEnglish Intermediate/advanceAble to distinguish actual versus expected results.Able to document using different tools, sources, diagrams and techniques.User Story WritingExperience or at least understanding about working within any Agile methodology framework.Able to understand Data Base basic concepts and to run simple queries.Client Facing.Plus: eInvoicing Flow and Brazilian tax regulationsPlus: Product Discovery and Impact analysis.What Does Sovos Offer You?The tools to grow your career both personally and professionally:That Can Happen Because Growth Is Serious Business Here At Sovos, And We Have The Programs In Place To Make Sure Of It, IncludingDid you know that over 30% of our employees earned a promotion or job change In FY2020.Mentoring ProgramsManagement Bootcamps and Development TrainingsYearly performance reviews where compensation and performance are assessed and rewarded generouslyClear paths for growth within our roles (but we know that career development can be like a spider web, not a ladder - we give you the tools to move outside of your career as well!)Are you worried that you don‚Äôt check all of the boxes? Apply anyway! There are no perfect candidates - we hire people, not resumes. We are excited that you‚Äôre here and we look forward to taking a look at your application to establish next steps.Sovos is an equal opportunity employer and those seeking employment with us are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Senior Digital Marketing Analyst - McKinsey Digital
description: QualificationsBarchelor‚Äôs degree in marketing or advertising6-8 years of experience executing and/or leading at-scale performance marketing programs for digital agencies or client marketing organizationsPrior experience in management consulting preferredStrong focus on customer acquisition ‚Äì managing performance marketing channels (e.g. search, programmatic, social, affiliate, email, conversion rate optimization) and/or CRM (e.g. managing customer data, segmentation and driving personalization of owned channels)Deep understanding of the ad-tech ecosystem with hands on experience with bid managers, DMP‚Äôs and DSP‚Äôs, leveraging 1st and 3rd party to data to drive marketing impactExperience with marketing analytics (e.g. Google Anlytics 360¬∫, Adobe Analytics, etc.) and attribution modelAbility to think quickly and critically on a broad range of digital marketing topics across various verticalsData-driven thinkerComfortable working with business, marketing and IT stakeholdersProfessional attitude and service orientation; team playerExcellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate with senior marketing leaders and C-level executivesWillingness to travelWhat You'll DoYou will provide a distinctive level of subject matter expertise on how to develop and deliver digital marketing strategies that accelerate customer acquisition and customer value.In this role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work directly with consulting teams to conduct assessments of client capabilities and performance, playing a significant role in team problem solving through the findings and insights from diagnostics and assessments. You will contribute to defining the implications to the client operating model, new roles and org implications, and operating processes. You will also contribute to the strategies and solutions for marketing technology.Leveraging your expertise, you‚Äôll help to advance McKinsey‚Äôs overall knowledge base by contributing to and expanding our diagnostic and assessment toolkit and approach. You will develop new frameworks, approaches and techniques in addition to building on existing ones.Who You'll Work WithYou'll join our Sao Paulo digital studio as part of Digital McKinsey. Digital McKinsey brings together the best of McKinsey‚Äôs digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.As part of this group, you‚Äôll join a global team working on modernizing the marketing organizations of leading clients to develop best in class digital marketing and personalization capabilities. You will help clients accelerate customer acquisition and customer value in new and exciting ways leveraging digital channels, data, analytics, marketing technology, and agile marketing operating models.You‚Äôll typically work on projects across all industries and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm. You‚Äôll work with colleagues from across the firm to help our clients launch agile marketing and personalization programs at scale, enabled by data and technology. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to plug into exciting large scale marketing and digital transformations.Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

title: Sr. Business Analyst - SAP Tax
description: Our client is a start up company focused on customized solutions for their clients. This is an exciting position to work with international teams based in the USA, India and Brazil to launch a brand new SAP product to the market.In this position you will...Provide subject matter expertise on tax determination, reporting and compliance (including e-invoicing) for LATAM marketPerform detailed analysis, feasibility, and integration design of business processes within ERP modules (MM, SD, and FI) to the integrationAssist in project management, implementation planning and test approach / planningPrepare detailed Functional Specification documentation with use cases, PowerPoint presentations, and other documents to explain requirements internally and externally.Support the product development process, working closely with Development, QA and Documentation teams throughout the whole product life cycle, feature validating functionality, as well as preparing the rest of the organization for product release.Assist with end-user documentation, process flows, specifications, and diagrams to provide direction to customers, partners and professional services, and support teams.Support product rollouts and implementations as domain expert and/or primary business interface to other parties.In this position you will need...Solid understanding of tax data flow between organizational systems, technical architecture, integrations, and data pipelines between ERP and Tax/ compliance systems (SAP MM, SAP SD)Excellent communication skills and ability to work cross functionally other Functional Consultants, Developers/A Architects, Sales, Professional Services, Customer Support, Tax Research, Customers and ProspectExperience in LATAM Operations, especially Brazil and Argentina.Experienced in Brazil Nota Fiscal, SPED and E- Invoicing.Experience in ERP Systems (SAP)Fluent EnglishFeeling excited about this challenge? Apply now or send your CV to: mariana.tomiyoshi@robertwalters.com

title: Senior Commercial Finance Analyst
description: Feedzai is the world‚Äôs first RiskOps platform, and market leader in safeguarding global commerce with today‚Äôs most advanced cloud-based risk management platform, powered by machine learning and artificial intelligence. Feedzai is securing the transition to a cashless world while enabling digital trust in every transaction and payment type. The world‚Äôs largest banks, processors, and retailers trust Feedzai to protect trillions of dollars and manage risk while improving the customer experience for everyday users, without compromising privacy. Feedzai is a Series D company and has raised $282M to date with a current valuation of $1.5B. Its technology protects 800 million people in 190 countries.Reporting to the Commercial Finance Business Partner, the Commercial Finance Senior Analyst will provide end to end commercial finance support for specific in scope business areas. In this role, the Senior Analyst will support non-finance functions such as Sales, Partner Development, Account Management, Pre-Sales in all deal related financial aspects, by providing insightful analysis to assist management in making well-informed commercial decisions, and challenge the business to make improvements, such as maximizing growth and improve financial performance. This person will be responsible for forecasting and executing on the Exit ARR targets for the business units along with developing pricing strategy.The Senior Analyst‚Äôs work in pricing will be dedicated to maximize deal value and structure to support Feedzai‚Äôs KPIs. They will analyze, implement and support pricing and packaging strategies for Feedzai‚Äôs growing breadth of products, maximizing clients monetization.We are seeking a dynamic, experienced Commercial Finance Senior Analyst with leadership skills, pricing strategy experience, strong financial acumen, and Go to Market process orientation to drive predictable and profitable ARR growth.Managing ongoing forecasting of regional exit ARR to ensure commercial risks and opportunities are highlighted and addressedManaging ongoing forecasting of business unit exit ARR to ensure commercial risks and opportunities across new ARR and renewals are highlighted and addressedLeads and guides Feedzai‚Äôs partner pricing strategy, taking necessary actions to enhance profitability, ensure structure and integrity in all pricing matters. Supports and engages in partnerships that can fast-track Feedzai‚Äôs growthSupporting the annual financial planning process from a Revenue & ARR perspective for Partners and Sales Regions in scopeEstimate the ROI for Marketing investments and work with regional marketing team to measure and drive accountability on resultsDriving business value by offering expert financial and analytical advice to assist in ARR and Revenue enhancing decision-making processesPerforms scenario modeling and margin calculations for business opportunitiesPerforming both contract and customer profitability analysis and focus on value creation plans that capture customers maximum willingness to payDriving margin enhancement initiatives, structure deals to drive optimal ROIProvides support to sales and responds to RFPs with pricing solutions for clientsActs as a role model by being a source of advice and knowledge regarding customer issuesPreparing insightful reporting and analysis to support management decision making, and identify significant trends/issues, e.g. monitor performance against forecast and pipeline. For example analysis of sales/margins - volume, price, mix vs. forecast - identifying issues, recommending actions, measuring outcomesProviding finance business partner support to Sales, Marketing, Customer Success leaders, influencing behaviors and performance through insights and understanding of key drivers and trendsCollaborate with Revenue and Billing Associates on Revenue, ARR, Billing and Collections performance measurement and forecastingOther duties as needed or required2-5 years‚Äô experience in Pricing/Commercial Finance/FP&A roles, preferably within FinTech/Payments and SaaS is a plusBachelors or Masters degree in Business Administration, Finance, Marketing or related fieldsAbility to analyze data, draw insights, and translate into business recommendationsStrong proficiency in advanced Excel, GSuite (Google Sheets), Financial modeling, Data analysisStrong interpersonal skills with experience collaborating and working on a teamStrong written, verbal communication and presentation skillsFlexible and able to perform, prioritize and thrive in a fast-paced and growth-oriented environmentStrong Go to Market and Sales Cycle Business PerspectiveExperience evaluating, adjusting and implementing Go To Market Strategies and new pricing structures|Your First 30-Days At FeedzaiYou will be immersed in our brand with training, connections, and one-on-one time with your manager. You may shadow your colleagues virtually or onsite at an office depending on where you work as you are supported through your Feedzai journey. In addition, you will have access to a ton of information to give you history, context, and all the knowledge you can handle about Feedzai and the team. Finally, you will start working on projects and collaborating on work currently being done. We can't wait to have you join the team!Life at Feedzai InstagramFeedzai CultureFeedzai is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Feedzai does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

title: Senior Marketing Analyst
description: Summary of the role:The LatAm Senior Marketing Analyst is responsible for delivery of an accurate picture of marketing effectiveness across all business units, regions, and campaigns, with past, real-time, and future-looking lenses. By identifying actionable intelligence from website, lead generation, and marketing program data, this position helps the LatAm Marketing organization use data to drive fact-based decision making. The role will also be called upon to communicate these results to stakeholders and provide suggestions based on their findings to influence business decisions.Job Description:Create, deliver, and interpret weekly, monthly, and ad hoc marketing reporting both from existing tools (e.g., Tableau) as well as self-generatedLead monthly Marketing Scorecard process for LatAm Marketing pulling together monthly and year-to-date marketing performance KPIs and commentaryProcess and extract insight from marketing, digital data, and other sources to drive decision making within the businessLead and maintain an accurate, holistic view of marketing business performance report across all business units and regions ‚Äì look for actionable insight (or predictive insight) rather than simply reporting on what happened alreadyOwn annual marketing performance targets and maintain updates throughout the year as needed (e.g., determine new targets based on budget and resourcing shifts)Partner with Activation Advisor counterparts to deliver full marketing funnel reporting and insights running from traffic generation all the way through to customer saleAct as liaison for LatAm Marketing team to bring dashboard and reporting requirements / needs to lightKey Skills for the role:Demonstrable experience as a Marketing Analyst enabling Segment, Business Unit, Region, Campaign, etc. level data and reportingKnowledge of suitable data analytic processes and data source structuresActively identify and participate in driving increased data quality and efficiency improvements, standardization, and business system enhancementsStrong ability to prioritize, complete tasks independently with a high degree of accuracy, work with attention to detail, and deal with ambiguitySkilled in navigating complex organizations, systems, and processes, distilling complexity into digestible reports, and communicating to stakeholdersExperience and Qualifications:Bachelor‚Äôs degree required; degree in Marketing or Analytics preferred5-7 years of professional marketing operations or marketing analysis experienceFluent English written and oral communication skillsStrong technical skills including Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel), Adobe Analytics, Tableau, SFDCCurious, adaptable, self-starterKnowledge of professional services industry, especially legal or tax, is a plusWhat‚Äôs in it For You?At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Hybrid Work Model: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote throughout 2021. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters caf√© networking.Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we‚Äôve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world‚Äôs most global news services ‚Äì Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.AccessibilityAs a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.
